tourName: Kenya and Tanzania safari highlights, incl Zanzibar
generalInfo: The perfect introduction to Tanzania & Kenya. Featuring Kenya’s finest national parks: Maasai Mara and Lake Nakuru, as well as Tanzania’s northern circuit. This safari includes popular highlights and hidden gems found along the famous route. Starting in Nakuru National Park and the Maasai Mara, you’ll also visit Lake Victoria, Ngorongoro Crater, Tarangire National Park and the Serengeti.

dayInfo.description: After an early morning pick-up from Jomo Kenyata international airport, you will drive to Lake Nakuru National Park. Lake Nakuru lies across the equator and southward of Bogoria in the Great Rift Valley. It is known worldwide for its flamingos and is recognized as one of the world’s natural wonders. Lake Nakuru is also a rhino sanctuary, harbouring a population of over 40 black and over 60 white rhinos. The flamingos, of course, have always been the main attraction. There may be almost two million flamingos in residence at any given time, forming a stunningly beautiful deep pink band around the edge of the lakeshore. You will arrive in time for lunch and an afternoon game drive.

After breakfast drive to Masai Mara National Reserve. This is one of the few places left on earth where wildlife still lives comparatively undisturbed in the numbers that were once common across all the plains and forests of Africa. As the northern tip of the vast Serengeti ecosystem, the Mara hosts the spectacular seasonal migration of thousands of wildebeest, zebras, and attendant predators. You will arrive in time for lunch, followed by an afternoon game drive.

After breakfast, a full-day game drive in the Masai Mara (lunch will be a picnic). The reserve is well known for its black-maned lions and abundant wildlife. This is one of the few places where it’s possible to see the big five during a morning game drive. Many cheetahs are so tame that they seek shelter from the hot sun under vehicles. Several climbs onto the roof to get a better view of prospective prey! For bird enthusiasts – almost 500 species have been recorded here. Among these include 16 species of eagle, many hawks, and falcons, six species of vultures, eight species of storks, four species of bustard (including the Kori bustard, the world’s heaviest flying bird), and nine species of sunbirds.

Today after breakfast you will be transferred from Masai Mara kenya to the boarder with Tanzania Isebania. upon arrival and M&G with your Tanzanian driver guide you will be transferred to Lake Victoria for leisure.

Today after breakfast you will be at leisure. Ocasionaly the Lake Victoria water rise for a period and this water-based camp suddenly is full of Tilapia fish and hippo under walkways. Cultural visits to nearby fishing village can be taken from the camp returning by boat via the fabulous Little Okavango Tower where you can enjoy brunch and a relax whilst in the views.

Today after breakfast drive to Serengeti National Park for the game drive. The name Serengeti came from Maasai word which means the “plains with no end”. Enjoy the amazing landscape from the sea of the waving grass dotted with acacia and marula trees to the water points where there is always drama between herbivorous and predators. Arrive at your tented camp in the evening.

Today Start your day with an early Morning game drive. As you drive through the the hillside, the vast Serengeti spreads out before you as far as the eyes can see. This 6,900 sq. mile (18,000 sq. km) park is inhabited by more than two million large animals, including more than a million wildebeest, hundreds of thousands of plains zebras, and Thomson’s gazelles. Large predators, including lions, cheetahs, and hyenas, are drawn to the area by the abundance of prey that migrates throughout the park. Return to your camp in the afternoon for lunch and proceed with an evening game drive later.

Today you will have a full day game drive in Serengeti with an optional of flying with a hot air balloon. Depend on your preference you can do the full day game drive or return to your camp in the afternoon for the hot lunch and proceed with the game drive later.

Today after an early breakfast head off to Ngorongoro Crater for the crater tour. Just 10 miles wide, Ngorongoro Crater was formed from a collapsed volcano. It is now a self-sustaining ecosystem with the densest predator population in Africa – you may be able to spot the Big 5 in a single afternoon!

Today after breakfast, drive to lake Manyara National Park, the park known for it’s tree-climbing lions. It’s been suggested that this unusual behavior's probably started during a fly epidemic when the cats climbed high to escape the swarms of biting flies on the ground, so present ongoing behavior is now part of their collective memory. Lake Manyara National Park is small, stretching only some 330 square km (127 square miles) along the base of the escarpment, with two thirds of it’s surface taken up by shallow alkaline Lake Manyara. Late on drive to your lodge Manyara’s secrets for leisure and overnight.
Today after your breakfast transfer to Arusha airport for your flight to Zanzibar Island. Upon arrival in Zanzibar meet and greet and transfer to a beach hotel.

You will have four full days to do exactly what you want – or as little as you want. After all, you can simply relax by your hotel pool or down on the beach, perhaps under a swaying palm tree. If a day of total inactivity is not your thing, you can swim or take advantage of one of the activities on offer via your hotel reception. Optional Island Activities.

Today enjoy the breakfast at your hotel, transfer to Stone town, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Over the centuries, many cultures have left their impressions on Zanzibar and it is perhaps in Stone Town where you can most easily see their influences.Your guide will lead you first to the colourful market, awash with exotic smells and buzzing with bartering locals. Afterwards, you will visit the calm of the 19th century cathedral, built on the former site of the slave market after the 1873 abolition of slavery. As you wander the narrow streets and alleys, you will pass the Arab houses with their inner courtyards, hidden behind heavy doors. You can compare their style with the Indian residences, adorned with balustrades and metal railings.
Today is the last day of this great trip of your life time ,you'll transfer to Zanzibar aiport for your flight back home. Karibu sana
